translation.en: [reporter 1] This GameStop situation is the craziest I think I've ever seen.
translation.ko: 게임스톱 사태처럼 황당한 경우는 처음 봐요

translation.en: [man] I didn't know anything about it.
I had just come through some unbelievably bad back surgery.
translation.ko: 아주 심각한 허리 수술을 받은 참이었거든요

translation.en: I had been under the knife and then deeply sedated for the whole week, okay,
translation.ko: 수술대에 올랐다가 그 주 내내 진정제에 취해 있었죠

translation.en: so I put on the network.
[reporter 2] …not think about upside possibility,
because when's the last time you walked into the store GameStop yourself?
translation.ko: 그도 그럴 것이 요즘 누가 게임스톱 가게에 가나요? "게임스톱 (GME) 325달러"

translation.en: [man] What the hell is GameStop doing?
That's like a 20 dollar stock, and it's at 400.
Give me the phone.
[Jim] I asked for the control room.
Here's the deal, guys.
There isn't anyone who's involved with GameStop,
who'd accept the fact that this company should be at 338.
People are thinking, "This is a home run."
Take the home run, don't go for the grand slam.
translation.ko: 홈런으로 만족해요 그랜드 슬램까지 노리지 말고요

translation.en: You've already won. You've won the game.
translation.ko: 여러분이 이미 이겼어요 이 게임에서 이겼다고요 "내 거시기나 빨아, 짐 크레이머"

translation.en: It was at that very moment that I became the target of 10 million people.
translation.ko: "내 거시기나 빨아, 짐 크레이머" "이기려는 게 아니라 놈들이 지게 만들려는 거야" 저는 그 순간 1,000만 명의 표적이 되고 말았죠

translation.en: I don't even understand what I did.
What did I do?
Like, why do they put my head on top of different things?
translation.ko: 왜 제 얼굴을 온갖 곳에 합성하는 거죠? "헤지펀드 매니저의 100% 실제 생방송"

translation.en: They think guys like me who are trying to help people are the enemy.
translation.ko: 그들은 남을 도우려는 저 같은 사람을 적으로 생각해요

translation.en: I mean, what is their mission?
What are they determined to do?
Change the face of capitalism?
♪ Do you like that? Do you like that? Do you like that? ♪
[narrator] This is not financial advice.
[reporter 1] Underemployed, sitting at home,
using the power of the Internet to destroy the kings of American finance.
translation.ko: 인터넷의 힘으로 미국의 금융 왕들을 무너뜨리죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] We have seen a massive surge in the stock price--
[reporter 3] …on a company called, "GameStop."
GameStop is a store at a mall.
They sell video games, like Pong or Frogger.
[reporter 4] Check-out shares of GameStop surging another 51%.
[reporter 5] Three hundred percent.
[reporter 6] A band of Redditors forced those hedge funds
to liquidate billions of dollars in losses.
translation.ko: 수십억 달러나 손해 보고 청산하도록 했습니다

translation.en: It's always fun to see hedge-funders getting screwed, isn't it?
translation.ko: 헤지펀드가 망하는 걸 보면 늘 재미있죠? "멜빈 캐피털, 게임스톱 재앙"

translation.en: [reporter 7] It was supposed to power people,
when push came to shove, it took power away.
translation.ko: 궁지에 몰리자 오히려 권력을 빼앗아 가 버렸죠

translation.en: [reporter 8] David versus Goliath.
[reporter 9] The ultimate David and Goliath story.
[reporter 10] We have come dangerously close
translation.ko: "헤지펀드가 망하도록 게임스톱을 사는 나" 시스템 전체가 붕괴할 위험에 처했습니다

translation.en: to the collapse of the entire system.
♪ Look at all these slave masters ♪
[narrator] There are two ways to make money in life.
translation.ko: 돈을 버는 데는 두 가지 방법이 있습니다

translation.en: There's the slow, steady path to prosperity,
translation.ko: 느리고 꾸준하게 번영을 향해 나아가는 길과

translation.en: or there's getting rich quick, like, really quick.
translation.ko: 빨리, 정말 빠르게 부자가 되는 길이 있죠 "당첨!"

translation.en: Well, this is the story of how a lucky few made that happen
translation.ko: 이건 운 좋은 소수가 게임스톱 주식을 사들여

translation.en: by buying up shares of GameStop,
and believe it or not, it could happen again.
translation.ko: 믿거나 말거나 다시 일어날 수도 있는 일이죠

translation.en: So, let's go back to the beginning, the year 2020,
translation.ko: "금융 조언이 아닙니다!" 모든 게 시작된 2020년으로 돌아가 보죠

translation.en: back when Covid was fresh in our brains,
translation.ko: 코로나가 우리 머릿속에 새롭게 각인되던 때입니다

translation.en: and some brave folks discovered
there was gold to be mined in a broken-down video game store.
translation.ko: 허름한 비디오 게임 가게에 금광이 묻혀 있단 걸 발견했죠

translation.en: [man] Be careful, okay? Be very careful.
Okay, I'm gonna put the pancakes on, okay?
-Then I put the chocolate chips. -[man] Yes, sir.
translation.ko: - 그럼 내가 초콜릿 칩을 넣을게요 - 네, 대장님

translation.en: -Hold on. -[boy] But you're the boss.
[man] Yeah? Sometimes I feel like you're the boss.
translation.ko: 그래? 가끔은 네가 대장인 것 같은데

translation.en: I'm Eddie. I'm 38 years old.
Actually, wait, how old am I now?
translation.ko: 실은, 잠깐… 내가 몇 살이지? "에디 쿠 개인 투자자, 레디터"

translation.en: Don't even know, I'm losing track.
I'm 39, actually.
Yeah, 39.
What else do you want to know?
Me and my wife both work,
but after Covid hit with young toddlers,
translation.ko: 하지만 아기가 있는데 코로나 사태가 터지니

translation.en: um, it's, you know, been challenging balancing work and childcare.
translation.ko: 일과 육아 사이에서 균형을 찾기가 힘들었죠

translation.en: -[woman] Good job. -Is that enough?
[woman] That's plenty.
[Eddie] Around the middle of July 2020,
my wife received notice that she was getting laid off due to Covid.
translation.ko: 아내가 코로나 때문에 해고 통보를 받았어요

translation.en: It's rough, you know?
[girl] He had more fun.
[Eddie] A lot of thoughts crossed my mind.
Do I have to take a second job?
Do I have to bartend on the weekend or be an Uber driver?
translation.ko: '주말에 바텐더 일을 하거나 우버 기사로 일할까?'

translation.en: But, with two young kids, I want to be there for them,
translation.ko: 하지만 어린 두 아이가 있으니 곁에 머무르며

translation.en: be a good parent, right?
Let's wash it over here.
We had to figure out what we were gonna do.
There you go.
Historically, when we look at financial crises,
translation.ko: 역사적으로 금융 위기를 보면 "비키 보건 박사 코넬대 경제학 교수"

translation.en: who are the big losers?
You think about the 2008 mortgage crisis,
it was the households.
[woman 1] I remember my dad lost his job,
and we lost the house.
translation.ko: "앤젤리카 텍선 개인 투자자, 레디터" 집을 잃었어요

translation.en: [woman 2] My parents lost their house.
House went into foreclosure, had to move.
So, that was a big one.
I was in high school at the time,
translation.ko: 전 당시 고등학생이었는데 지금도 생생히 기억나요

translation.en: and I distinctly remember at that Thanksgiving,
translation.ko: 전 당시 고등학생이었는데 지금도 생생히 기억나요 "맷 코어스 개인 투자자, 유튜브 핀플루언서"

translation.en: the talk at that point was just how much money everyone was losing.
translation.ko: 추수 감사절에 모여 다들 돈을 얼마나 잃었나 얘기했죠

translation.en: [woman 3] My dad lost his job.
I mean, he went to work one morning, and the doors were chained up,
translation.ko: 어느 날 아침 출근했는데 회사 문이 사슬로 묶여 있었죠

translation.en: and his house got foreclosed.
He had lost everything.
translation.ko: 모든 걸 잃으셨어요 "대니얼 & 다이애나 윌슨 개인 투자자, 레디터"

translation.en: [Vicki Bogan] The Wall Street banks,
they did poorly for a little bit,
but then they recovered.
[Henry Waxman] It seems that the system worked for you,
translation.ko: 시스템이 당신에게 유리하게 작용하는 것 같군요

translation.en: but it didn't seem to work for the rest of the country.
translation.ko: 이 나라의 나머지 사람들에겐 불리하기만 한데 말이죠

translation.en: [crowd chanting] Stay here! Stay here! Stay here!
I get this picture in my mind when the media was downtown on Wall Street.
translation.ko: 시내 월스트리트에 언론이 몰려들었던 때가 떠올라요

translation.en: And those motherfuckers were standing up there on the balcony,
like, popping champagne bottles, and laughing,
taking pictures of these people down there
that have lost their houses to this crash.
translation.ko: 이 사태로 집을 잃은 사람들 말이에요

translation.en: [narrator] Turns out, it was actually guests at a restaurant up on that balcony,
but it didn't matter.
Everyone looked like a villain.
[woman] My first job right out of college was working at Morgan Stanley.
translation.ko: 대학 졸업 후 처음 일한 곳이 모건 스탠리였어요

translation.en: I remember asking my boss at the time,
how will the public ever forgive us for the bailout?
translation.ko: '우리가 긴급구제 신청한 걸 대중이 용서하긴 할까요?' "알렉시스 골드스타인 공개 시장 협회 재무 정책 담당자"

translation.en: And he sort of was, like, "Well, here's the thing."
"Eventually, the public will forget, and everything will go back to normal."
translation.ko: '결국 대중은 잊을 거고 모든 게 정상으로 돌아갈 거야'

translation.en: "We'll go back to getting the same bonuses we were getting."
translation.ko: '우린 예전과 같은 보너스를 받게 될 거고'

translation.en: "It will just be the way that it was."
People saw those bailouts,
and then the stock market rallied for a decade after the financial crisis,
translation.ko: "군잔 바네르지 '월스트리트 저널'" 금융 위기 이후 10년간 주식 시장은 회복됐지만

translation.en: and a lot of individual investors
did not participate in the stock market's gains.
translation.ko: 주식 시장의 이익을 나눠 받지 못했어요

translation.en: [Jason Mudrick] When you get a wider and wider gap between haves and have-nots,
translation.ko: "뉴욕주 뉴욕" 가진 자와 못 가진 자의 차이가 점점 더 벌어지면 분노하는 사람이 나오기 마련이죠

translation.en: there's going to be people that are upset.
I actually don't think it's necessarily bad.
translation.ko: 전 그게 나쁜 것만은 아니라고 봅니다 "제이슨 머드릭"

translation.en: I think it's an outcome of a system that has worked incredibly well.
translation.ko: "머드릭 캐피털 매니지먼트 설립자 헤지펀드 매니저" 시스템이 놀랍도록 잘 작동한 결과라고 생각해요

translation.en: My name is Jason Mudrick,
founder and Chief Investment Officer of Mudrick Capital Management.
We're a sophisticated, multi-billion dollar hedge fund.
translation.ko: 우리는 수십억 달러 규모의 잘 짜인 헤지펀드입니다

translation.en: While there's always stuff to do,
there's a lot to do following a recession.
So, while 2007 and 2008 may have been a quote, unquote, "scary time,"
translation.ko: 그래서 2007년과 2008년이 이른바 '두려운 시기'이긴 했지만 "폐업 17만 건 실직 1,110만 명"

translation.en: for our strategy, it was a great time.
[Vicki] And then you have this pandemic,
and again, the little guy lost their jobs, their retirement,
translation.ko: 힘없는 사람들은 또다시 직장과 은퇴 자금을 잃었지만

translation.en: but the people that were running the firms that made the decisions,
translation.ko: 회사를 운영하며 중요한 결정을 내리는 이들은

translation.en: a lot of them didn't suffer as much.
It's very Darwinian, there's winners and losers.
[Jason] Are we trying to profit? Absolutely.
Folks pay me to invest capital on their behalf
translation.ko: 사람들은 자기들 대신 투자하라고 제게 돈을 줘요

translation.en: because they believe that we're really good at this.
translation.ko: 다들 우리가 투자를 아주 잘한다고 생각하니까요

translation.en: [narrator] And hedge funds are very good at it.
But what is a hedge fund, exactly?
Let's ask this guy.
My name's Peter Sasaki.
I was in the hedge fund business for 20 years.
I enjoy the fact that markets are like a chess game,
translation.ko: 시장은 체스 게임과 비슷하다는 점에서 재미있어요

translation.en: but it can be a very lucrative chess game.
It's not just finance and valuations,
it's history, it's market psychology,
it's understanding how the world moves.
It is incredibly difficult to beat the market.
translation.ko: 지수 대비 초과 성과를 내는 건 매우 어렵죠

translation.en: So, the idea behind hedge funds was
you'll have an investment portfolio that is less subject to market swings
translation.ko: 시장 변동에 영향을 덜 받고 시장 평균보다 높은 수익을 내는

translation.en: and should outperform the market.
That's what investors are looking for,
that's what managers are trying to deliver.
[narrator] Hedge funds have ways to cash in
if the stock goes up, down, or even sideways.
translation.ko: 그대로 유지되더라도 이익을 낼 방법을 압니다

translation.en: They do this by pooling together money from investors.
translation.ko: 이를 위해서는 투자자들로부터 돈을 모아야 하죠

translation.en: Not small potato investors,
but high net-worth individuals.
And then hedge fund managers will find creative ways to invest that money.
translation.ko: 그러고는 이 돈을 투자할 창의적인 방법을 생각해 내죠

translation.en: One of these strategies is called short selling.
translation.ko: 이런 전략 중 하나가 바로 공매도입니다

translation.en: Short selling is a bet that a security is going to go down.
translation.ko: 공매도는 주가 하락에 돈을 거는 겁니다

translation.en: Say you own a share of IBM, okay?
translation.ko: 당신이 IBM 주식을 갖고 있다 치죠

translation.en: I say, "Can I borrow that share?"
You say, "Sure, I don't need it right now, I'm not planning on selling it."
translation.ko: '그럼요, 당장은 필요 없어요 팔 생각 없거든요' "차용증"

translation.en: So, I take it, I sell it for $10.
Let's say the stock goes down, 20% next month, and is now at $8.
translation.ko: 다음 달에 주가가 20% 하락해 이제 8달러가 됐다고 하죠

translation.en: Okay, I buy it back at $8, give you your share back.
translation.ko: 주식을 8달러에 다시 사서 당신에게 돌려주는 거죠

translation.en: You're in the same place you would've been.
You have your share of IBM,
but I made two dollars,
and that's how short selling works.
[narrator] Now, take that two dollars and slap a whole lot of zeros on the end.
translation.ko: 이제 그 2달러 뒤에 0을 잔뜩 붙여 보죠

translation.en: Now we're talking.
That's the kind of money a hedge fund can make
when they short shares of a dying stock.
translation.ko: 이 정도의 돈을 벌 수 있어요

translation.en: Shorting is just a way of saying,
"We think that the stock price will go down."
"And we're going to bet that the stock price goes down."
That tells you that that stock is in trouble.
translation.ko: 즉 그 주식에 문제가 있다는 뜻이고

translation.en: Usually they're right.
[Andrew Metrick] What happens then is that the company can't get any more capital,
translation.ko: "이런" 그러면 회사는 자금을 더 받지 못하게 되어

translation.en: and it becomes insolvent.
Then it will be a self-fulfilling prophecy.
The fact that it's done by hedge funds, who tend to be really wealthy,
translation.ko: 돈이 아주 많은 헤지펀드가 이런 짓을 하니

translation.en: it kind of looks like a cartoon villain.
translation.ko: "앤드루 메트릭 예일대 경영대학원 교수" 만화 속 악당처럼 보이죠

translation.en: [narrator] But there's one big catch to shorting.
translation.ko: 그런데 공매도에는 큰 함정이 하나 있습니다

translation.en: If the price suddenly starts to go up,
then hedge funds could take a hit.
[narrator] And lose a yacht-load of money.
translation.ko: 어마어마한 돈을 잃을 수도 있다는 거죠

translation.en: If we buy a stock at $50,
we know that if the stock goes to zero,
how much can I lose?
Fifty dollars. Right?
If I short a stock,
the stock can go up to infinity.
I can actually lose more money than I placed in that bet.
translation.ko: 제가 그 내기에 건 것보다 더 큰 돈을 잃을 수도 있죠

translation.en: So, it can be picking up nickels in front of a freight train,
translation.ko: 달려오는 화물열차 앞에서 동전을 줍는 것과 비슷해요

translation.en: and it sort of works until you get run over.
translation.ko: 기차에 치이기 전까지는 이득을 보는 거죠

translation.en: So, a lot of times what they'll do is
they'll find a really big struggling company like, Toys "R" Us, for instance.
translation.ko: 고전 중인 큰 회사를 찾아요 토이저러스가 한 예죠

translation.en: Toys "R" Us has filed for bankruptcy.
The retailer's reportedly about five billion dollars in debt…
They're like, "We know this company is about to go under."
translation.ko: '우린 이 회사가 곧 도산하리란 걸 알아'

translation.en: "So we're going to short the ever-living shit out of it,
until no investor is going to come in and try to save it anymore."
translation.ko: '회사를 살리려는 투자자가 아무도 안 남을 때까지'

translation.en: Whose idea was that?
It was Brad's.
I can't take my kids to Toys "R" Us and see Geoffrey
translation.ko: 제프리를 보러 애들과 토이저러스에 갈 수 없게 됐어요

translation.en: because you're an ass and wanted a new boat.
translation.ko: 망할 헤지펀드가 새 보트를 사고 싶어 해서요

translation.en: [woman] Aw, sad. Oh, what a sad day.
Let him cross the street, stop your car.
translation.ko: 길 건너게 해 주자, 차 세워

translation.en: We met when he was in the Army,
translation.ko: 우리는 이이가 군대에 있을 때 만나서

translation.en: and it just kind of evolved from there.
I actually started investing back in 2007.
And my friend at the time was like,
"GameStop is a really good stock, 'cause, like, you know,
translation.ko: '게임스톱은 좋은 주식이야' ''월드 오브 워크래프트' 거대 공급사거든'

translation.en: they're a big World of Warcraft provider."
I was a big World of Warcraft-er.
I was addicted to it.
I was, like, "Buy me some of those."
translation.ko: 그래서 그 주식을 조금 사겠다고 했어요

translation.en: So, they were actually my first stocks that I bought,
translation.ko: 실은 그게 제가 처음으로 산 주식이었어요

translation.en: so it has sentimental value to me.
[Desmund Delaney] GameStop was known for pre-owned games.
So, you buy Grand Theft Auto, play it for a year,
translation.ko: '그랜드 테프트 오토'를 사서 1년간 플레이하곤 이러는 거죠

translation.en: and you're like, "I'm tired of this game. I'll slip back to GameStop."
translation.ko: "데스먼드 딜레이니" '이 게임은 이제 질렸어 게임스톱에 팔래'

translation.en: On average, GameStop would resell the same game six times
translation.ko: 게임스톱은 게임 하나를 평균 여섯 번이나 되팔았어요

translation.en: which was very profitable.
And things started to go downhill when, effectively,
you saw publishers like Microsoft selling their games directly online.
translation.ko: 마이크로소프트 같은 제작사가 게임을 직접 온라인 판매 하면서요

translation.en: [man] All right, guys, heading into GameStop.
translation.ko: "게임스톱이 죽어간다 직접 체험" 자, 여러분 게임스톱에 들어갑니다

translation.en: Look at this place. It looks like a complete ghost town.
translation.ko: 이곳 좀 보세요 완전히 유령 마을 같네요

translation.en: [Diana] So I bought. And I watched the price just tank down.
translation.ko: 그래서 주식을 샀다가 가격이 폭락하는 걸 지켜봤죠

translation.en: Today, we're at another abandoned GameStop in Cranberry Township, Pennsylvania.
translation.ko: 오늘은 펜실베이니아주 크랜베리 타운십에 있는 또 다른 게임스톱 폐업 점포예요

translation.en: Everyone thought GameStop was the next Blockbuster.
translation.ko: 다들 게임스톱이 블록버스터의 뒤를 이을 거로 생각했죠

translation.en: A lot of people thought, "GameStop's overvalued."
"No one's going to these stores buying."
They just thought that the stock should go down.
[reporter] Video game retailer GameStop is not doing so well.
translation.ko: 비디오 게임 소매점 게임스톱이 고전하고 있습니다

translation.en: GameStop looks to be heading down the same path as Blockbuster and Sam Goody.
translation.ko: 블록버스터나 샘 구디와 같은 길을 갈 것 같군요

translation.en: [narrator] If there's money to be made, Wall Street is all over it, like…
translation.ko: 월스트리트는 돈을 벌 수 있다면 미친 듯이 달려들죠

translation.en: [narrator] And GameStop was no exception.
While GameStop stores were shutting down,
Wall Street was looking to make stupid money
off someone else's bad fortune.
It felt like 2008, all over again.
You buy companies that are doing good things,
translation.ko: 좋은 일을 하고 사업 계획을 실행에 옮기는

translation.en: executing on business plans,
and you short companies that are missing earnings.
translation.ko: 수익을 내지 못하는 회사는 공매도하는 거죠

translation.en: That's the concept of normally being a good investor.
There's companies that are clearly going out of business
that larger hedge fund managers will become comfortable,
and they'll be in it together.
[narrator] Various hedge funds, including Citadel and Point72,
were all betting that GameStop's stock price would go down.
The big one was Melvin Capital.
They were betting against GameStop.
[Andrew Left] Gabe Plotkin runs a hedge fund called Melvin.
translation.ko: "게이브 플롯킨 설립자 & CIO" 게이브 플롯킨은 멜빈이라는 헤지펀드를 운영해요

translation.en: He's an extremely intelligent person.
He's very thoughtful, cautious, compliant.
Everything someone wants in a hedge fund manager.
translation.ko: 헤지펀드 매니저에게 필요한 자질을 다 갖췄고

translation.en: Uh, and he has a track record that's unparalleled.
[narrator] He also had a track record of shorting gaming companies,
including taking a huge short position against Nintendo in 2018.
translation.ko: 2018년 닌텐도를 상대로 한 대규모 공매도를 포함해서요 "닌텐도 4억 달러 공매도"

translation.en: Move over Bowser, Nintendo has a new villain.
translation.ko: 바우저는 비키라죠 닌텐도에 새 악당이 생겼어요

translation.en: Gabe Plotkin was at SAC, a star trader.
He left and formed his own firm, Melvin Capital Managements,
translation.ko: 거기서 나와 자기 회사인 멜빈 캐피털을 설립했고요

translation.en: and apparently has a massive short position in Nintendo,
a 400 million-dollar short.
And the stock over that time has declined almost 30%.
translation.ko: 그 기간에 닌텐도 주가는 30% 가까이 떨어졌어요

translation.en: You know, I look at the size of my funds,
translation.ko: 우리 자금 규모와 업계 내 위치를 감안하면 충격적이에요

translation.en: and where we are in the industry, and it's kind of shocking to me.
translation.ko: 우리 자금 규모와 업계 내 위치를 감안하면 충격적이에요 "기대치를 스스로 정해라"

translation.en: I hate that guy.
He's betting on people's failure.
[Andrew Left] Why would you not short GameStop if you're going to short stocks?
translation.ko: 주식을 공매도할 거면 게임스톱을 안 팔 이유가 없죠

translation.en: We all know that they haven't innovated,
stores aren't doing well, haven't hit the numbers.
translation.ko: 매장도 잘 안 굴러가고 실적을 못 냈으니까요

translation.en: [narrator] If you look at it from Melvin's point of view,
shorting GameStop was like profiting off a sinking ship.
translation.ko: 가라앉는 배에서 이익을 취하는 거나 다름없었죠

translation.en: Every time GameStop hit another iceberg or took on water,
the stock dropped and Melvin made money.
But while Melvin was too busy watching GameStop's demise,
translation.ko: 하지만 멜빈은 게임스톱의 종말에 정신이 팔려

translation.en: they failed to see what was on the horizon.
Not another iceberg,
but a lifeboat sent out by a new school of investors
translation.ko: 갑자기 달려들어 게임스톱 주식을 살 준비가 된

translation.en: ready to swoop in and start buying up the stock.
None of the risk models account for extreme events
translation.ko: 어떤 위험 모델도 정상 표준 분포를 벗어나는

translation.en: that aren't within a normal standard distribution.
It is the thing that, you know, the probability of happening is infinitesimal,
translation.ko: 그런 현상이 일어날 가능성은 극히 희박하지만

translation.en: but it can still happen.
All right. Who wants to do a show?
Who's ready?
You want to know what disruption really looks like?
Well, you're looking at it.
I think it's Robinhood.
It's a privately-held operator
that launched its commission-free brokerage platform in 2015.
translation.ko: 2015년에 수수료 없는 중개 플랫폼을 처음 출시했죠 "로빈후드 주식과 인물"

translation.en: This company's growing like a weed, ten times since we saw them last in 2016,
translation.ko: 이 회사는 쑥쑥 성장 중이죠 2016년보다 열 배나 커졌어요

translation.en: threatening legacy operators,
forcing them to play by a new, good set of rules!
translation.ko: 새롭고 멋진 규칙을 따르도록 만들고 있죠!

translation.en: [Matt Kohrs] Robinhood is a brokerage web-app/phone-app that facilitates trading.
translation.ko: 로빈후드는 웹과 모바일 기반의 주식 중개 앱이에요

translation.en: Make an account on it, you can buy and sell stocks.
translation.ko: 계정을 만들어서 주식을 사고팔 수 있죠

translation.en: It's pretty popular because it's free,
it's free to trade, and the interface is super easy to use.
You know, using Robinhood is less like using a traditional financial product
translation.ko: 로빈후드는 전통적인 금융 상품과는 달라요 "블래드 테네브 로빈후드 공동 설립자, 2016년"

translation.en: where you have paperwork, you have to wait.
It's more similar to using a technology product,
like an Uber or an Instagram.
[Sloan] Your phone is everything, right?
And what happened is that Robinhood makes trading really easy,
translation.ko: 로빈후드 덕분에 주식 거래가 아주 쉬워지면서

translation.en: and that has changed everything.
When we first started Robinhood, we had, you know,
translation.ko: 처음 로빈후드를 시작했을 때는 "바이주 바트 로빈후드 공동 설립자"

translation.en: lived through the financial crisis of 2008.
translation.ko: "바이주 바트 로빈후드 공동 설립자" 2008년 금융 위기를 극복한 참이었어요

translation.en: And, from the very beginning,
our mission has been to democratize the financial system.
We all know the story of Robin Hood,
translation.ko: "로빈후드 모두를 위한 투자" 로빈 후드 이야기는 다들 알죠

translation.en: the story of robbing from the rich and giving to the poor.
translation.ko: 부자의 돈을 훔쳐서 가난한 이들에게 주는 의적이에요

translation.en: [Kohrs] That's what Robinhood the brokerage was.
translation.ko: 그게 주식 중개 앱 로빈후드의 의의였어요

translation.en: They were trying to help people get into the world of stock trading,
and help them make money within the world of the stock market.
translation.ko: 거기서 돈을 벌 수 있게 도와주는 앱이었죠

translation.en: [Cramer] It could be a game-changer for an entire industry.
translation.ko: 업계 전체의 판도를 바꿀 만한 앱이었어요

translation.en: Robinhood's got a handle on what millennials want.
translation.ko: 로빈후드는 밀레니얼 세대가 뭘 원하는지 잘 알아요

translation.en: The median age of the customers is 30,
and about half of them are first-time investors. I love that.
translation.ko: 절반 이상이 초보 투자자죠 마음에 들어요

translation.en: Um, I decided, "Okay, I'll just sign up for Robinhood and see where it goes."
translation.ko: 그래서 로빈후드에 가입해 어떻게 되는지 보기로 했죠

translation.en: Pretty intuitive.
You search up a stock ticker, and click, swipe, and send it off.
translation.ko: 종목 약자를 검색해서 클릭, 스와이프, 전송하죠

translation.en: [narrator] Eddie is what is traditionally known as a retail trader.
translation.ko: 에디는 전통적으로 개인 투자자라 불리는 사람입니다

translation.en: What is a retail trader?
It's someone like this.
I just, you know, buy stocks that I think will have a good future,
translation.ko: 전 그냥 앞으로 잘될 것 같은 주식을 사서

translation.en: and I just leave it alone.
I am notorious for day trading.
-He's like, "buy and hold." -[narrator] Or this.
translation.ko: - 이이는 사 두고 버티고요 - 이런 사람이나…

translation.en: I thought you have to go to an office or a bank,
translation.ko: 사무실이나 은행에 가서 이래야 하는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: say, "Hey, I want to buy this."
[narrator] Or even this.
What up? I'm Mikey Guggenheim,
Uh, I'm a rapper, filmmaker, entertainer extraordinaire,
translation.ko: 래퍼, 영화 제작자 뛰어난 연예인이자 "난 모델이야 무슨 뜻인지 알지?"

translation.en: and huge dinglebop.
And these are my friends, Rachael and Derik.
Erik with a "C."
I am a writer, producer,
kind of helping manage the Mikey Guggenheim thing.

translation.en: Assistant.
I'm not an assistant. I am… I'm stepping into a management role.
translation.ko: - 조수예요 - 조수 아니야 관리직을 맡을 참이에요

translation.en: -More like intern. -I'm not an intern.
Traditionally, retail was disconnected from one another.
translation.ko: "참고: 레이철은 인턴이 아니다" 전통적으로 개인 투자자는 서로 단절되어 있었어요

translation.en: Because there are millions of retail traders just buying
translation.ko: 수백만 명의 개인 투자자가 여기서 10달러 저기서 50달러 사는 식이니까요

translation.en: $10 here, $50 there.
And they're really not large movers in the market.
So, who was the herder of, like, retail?
What's the most popular show on television for retail?
translation.ko: 개인 투자자에게 가장 인기 있는 TV 쇼가 뭘까요?

translation.en: Hey, I'm Cramer. Welcome to Mad Money.
I'm trying to be "Jimmy Chill,"
but I keep seeing people saying the dumbest things,
translation.ko: 멍청한 소리를 하는 인간들 때문에 미칠 것 같아요!

translation.en: and it is beginning to drive me nuts.
translation.ko: 멍청한 소리를 하는 인간들 때문에 미칠 것 같아요! "3개 주요 지수 모두 상승 마감"

translation.en: I've always been a fan of Jim Cramer.
Jimmy Chill, man.
If I can find people stocks that can make them money,
translation.ko: 돈 벌 수 있는 종목을 알려주거나

translation.en: or if I can help them, teach them how to find stocks.
translation.ko: "짐 크레이머 CNBC '매드 머니' 진행자" 종목 찾는 법을 가르쳐 주거나…

translation.en: Now, that's what I do.
Now on YouTube, you can find so much information,
translation.ko: 지금은 유튜브에서 정보를 얼마든지 찾을 수 있지만

translation.en: but prior, there wasn't as much.
I had some kid take a selfie with me yesterday,
translation.ko: 어제 어떤 젊은이가 저랑 셀카를 찍었어요

translation.en: I said, "Why are you doing that?"
And he goes, "You taught me investing."
My job's not just to entertain,
translation.ko: 제 일은 즐거움을 주는 것만이 아니라

translation.en: but educate, teach, put in context. Call me.
translation.ko: 교육하고 가르치고 지식을 주는 거죠, 전화하세요

translation.en: The house always wins if you're unprepared,
translation.ko: 준비가 안 된 채 도박하면 카지노가 이기게 되어 있죠

translation.en: and they're playing against the house.
Now they want to tear down the house,
they want to burn the house down,
but they don't have a clue,
and they keep thinking you can beat the house.
[Bob Sloan] The retail investor, they have trouble getting the best data

translation.en: because data's expensive.
There's the Bloomberg Terminal.
It has information you can't get if you just have a brokerage account.
translation.ko: 주식 거래 계정에서 얻을 수 없는 정보를 제공하죠

translation.en: Bloomberg takes prices from the banking community

translation.ko: 중앙 애그리게이션 포인트에 게시된 가격을 전달 받아

translation.en: and make it available to their subscribers.
[Sasaki] Things that are published on a Bloomberg Terminal
would be verified to journalistic standards.
There's checks and balances in that process.
Our Bloomberg Terminal, I believe, is 20,000 a year,
translation.ko: 우리 블룸버그 터미널 비용은 1년에 2만 달러 정도지만

translation.en: we have 25 of them.
[Sloan] Yes, it's expensive,
translation.ko: "2021년 머드릭 캐피털의 터미널 총비용은 361,153.77달러" 네, 돈이 많이 들죠

translation.en: but the value you get out of it is worth every penny.
translation.ko: 하지만 거기서 얻는 정보는 충분히 그만한 가치가 있어요

translation.en: I don't think you can be a member of the financial community without it.
translation.ko: 터미널 정보 없이는 금융계의 일원이 될 수 없죠

translation.en: [Alexis Goldstein] If you're trying to play the same game
with the same strategy
against Wall Street,
it's not going to be easy to win.
So, you're just at a disadvantage,
which means you have to play a different game.
translation.ko: 그러니 다른 방식으로 게임을 해야 해요

translation.en: [man] My family and I moved from Nashville a month before the pandemic hit,
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 팬데믹 발발 한 달 전 내슈빌에서 이리 이사 왔죠

translation.en: and I want to be self-sufficient as possible.
I really enjoy growing CBD.
translation.ko: 저는 헴프 키우는 걸 좋아해요 "오스틴 토비트 서브레딧 관리자"

translation.en: I started getting into that hobby, keeps me sane.
translation.ko: 이 취미에 빠진 덕에 제정신을 유지하는 거예요

translation.en: My name is Austin Tobitt.
I am known as atobitt on Reddit.
All these people were all of a sudden interested
in making money in the stock market.
That's what got me into Reddit.
Reddit allows Internet communities to kind of convene around
translation.ko: 레딧은 인터넷 커뮤니티들이 특정 분야별로 "테일러 로렌즈 '워싱턴 포스트'"

translation.en: niche-specific interests.
All of a sudden there's this centralized place for things I'm interested in.
translation.ko: 갑자기 제가 관심 두는 주제에 초점을 맞춘 커뮤니티가 생겼죠

translation.en: There's a community for photography,
there's a community for astrology.
I can go on right now and make one on…
translation.ko: 지금 당장 새 커뮤니티를 만들 수도 있죠

translation.en: And anybody that wants to join that is free to join that.
translation.ko: "난간 핫도그" 원하는 사람은 누구나 자유롭게 가입할 수 있어요 "가입"

translation.en: You don't need your real name. Not like Facebook.
I like Reddit because my face is not in there.
translation.ko: 얼굴을 밝힐 필요가 없어서 레딧이 좋아요

translation.en: I can be anyone I want to be.
People develop pretty tight bonds through Reddit communities,
translation.ko: "차고의힘101" 사람들은 레딧 커뮤니티를 통해 강한 유대감을 쌓아요

translation.en: real deep friendships, and real deep camaraderie.
[Eddie] My friends were already trading stocks.
translation.ko: 제 친구들은 이미 주식 거래 중이었어요

translation.en: I had no idea how to buy and sell.
translation.ko: 전 주식을 사고파는 법을 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: That's how I discovered /wallstreetbets.
translation.ko: 그러다 월스트리트베츠를 알게 됐어요 "오늘의 톱 재무 경영 포럼"

translation.en: [Kohrs] There's a community called WallStreetBets.
[Rachael] There's like this crazy group of people that just are bouncing around

bursting through doors.
Oh, yeah!
[yells] Like, it's going up, going down!
-Yeah, big dick energy, like… -Yeah.
Wildness.
Uh, I've been on WallStreetBets,
fucking around on there for the last two and a half years.
translation.ko: "WSB의 신입 주식 투자자" 지난 2년 반 동안 어울려 놀았어요

translation.en: I mean, you saw people losing tons of money
and making tons of money.
[Erik] They're, like, degenerate gamblers, basically.

translation.en: [Gunjan Banerji] People are commiserating about their losses
translation.ko: "돈을 잃는 건 멋지니까" 사람들은 승리를 자랑하는 만큼이나

translation.en: as much as they're boasting about their wins.
That's what makes this community so interesting.
I'm on Reddit, but not even remotely in the same way.
translation.ko: 저도 레딧에 가긴 하지만 그 사람들과는 전혀 달라요

translation.en: I'm a lurker, for sure.
In real life too.
No, not in real life, I'm regular. Stop it.

translation.en: Outside bushes, know what I mean?

translation.en: -No, I don't lurk in real life. -Exactly what a lurker would say.

translation.en: -I don't want to explain I'm not a lurker. -Not many people are going to see this.

translation.en: [Taylor Lorenz] They have a lot of their own, sort of, lingo that they use,
translation.ko: 그들만의 은어를 많이 쓰죠 "내 매끈한 뇌에 주름 좀 새기게 도와줘" "내 의견을 물었죠"

translation.en: inside jokes, memes, things like that.
translation.ko: 농담이나 밈 같은 거요 "이 주식 급등 직전이야"

translation.en: People think of retail investors as stupid or, you know, uneducated,
translation.ko: "따면 도박이 아니야" 사람들은 개인 투자자가 멍청하고 무식하다고 생각하죠

I'm going to take the money right now

translation.ko: "도와줘! 고양이가 액정을 밟아서 이 주식에 전 재산을 박아 버렸어" 이런 현상이 일어나는 이유는

So…
-But you know, what do I know? -[chuckles]

Um…

Appreciate it very much, Tim Apple.
I thought that was hilarious, and so I picked Jeff Amazon

Thirty, mmm…

translation.en: a hedge fund with a short position can get squeezed from all sides,

translation.en: Whenever there's groups of people moving in the same direction,

DeepFuckingValue?
